page.title: 10ARMY BARRACKS SUTTON C'FIELD
page.content: {St.George's}barracks was originally the home of 216 R.A.F. Maintenance Unit during{World War Two.} In 1962 it became the depot of the Royal Fusiliers Brigade. Ten years later it assumed its present function as an{army recruit} selection centre for England,Wales and Northern Ireland. On average{12,000}potential recruits pass through the gates each year.They watch films and hear talks about army life.Then there are eight written {tests,}one of which is Use of English. There are also physical tests involving sit-ups,press-ups and general gym and circuit work. After succeeding in the preliminary tests,the prospective recruit faces long hours of{interviewing}to gauge the suitability of his or her attitude.
